About me

My passion for computers started at a young age and grew to a curiosity that I carry with me today. In college, that same curiosity led me into the field of software where I quickly learned it was a good fit for me.


With a year left until completing my Bachelor's degree in computer science, I dove into an internship which promptly led to being hired on full time as a Java Developer for the Division of Technology Services within the Utah Department of Health.


After nearly two years as a Java Developer, I shifted gears when I was offered my current position as a Software Engineer with Impartner where I've continued growing my skill set in designing, building, testing, and maintaining software.

Work Experience

Software Engineer - Impartner

Nov 2021 - Current

Working primarily in C#, ASP.NET, Javascript, Angular, Typescript, and HTML I am tasked with implementing custom portal designs and functionalities, using various external and proprietary APIs to integrate our applications with CRM (Content Relationship Management) platforms such as Salesforce, and designing, building, testing, and maintaining self-configurable Angular SaaS applications. Having been given the scrum master role in our Agile team, I carry out weekly standups followed by daily sprint sessions to target obstacles in our projects and improve our CI/CD processes.

Java Developer/IT Analyst - Utah Dept. of Health - DTS

Jan 2020 - Nov 2021

Working in a small agile team assigned to Medicaid and CHIP (Children's Health Insurance Program) systems, I designed, developed, tested, and maintained robust solutions for a wide variety of projects from responsive frontend applications to concurrency and load-balancing. I was also assigned the role of the project manager for various projects to ensure the sound delivery of the product as requested by the providers.
